dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in May, a 4.2 magnitude quake hit East Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in May, a four point two magnitude quake hit East Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC), a magnitude 4.2 earthquake occurred in East Kazakhstan on May 6 at 05:12 a.m. local time, at a depth of 1 kilometer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it was on the 6th, right? At 5:12 in the morning local time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it was on the sixth, right? At five twelve in the morning local time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC), a magnitude 4.2 earthquake occurred in East Kazakhstan on May 6 at 05:12 a.m. local time, at a depth of 1 kilometer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it was really shallow too—only one kilometer deep.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it was really shallow too-only one kilometer deep.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC), a magnitude 4.2 earthquake occurred in East Kazakhstan on May 6 at 05:12 a.m. local time, at a depth of 1 kilometer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because just a few days before that, uh, Kyrgyzstan had that 5.0 quake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because just a few days before that, uh, Kyrgyzstan had that five point zero quake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, on the morning of May 12, a magnitude 5.0 earthquake struck Kyrgyzstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then this one was actually recorded by Kazakh seismologists from their National Scientific Center for Seismological Observations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then this one was actually recorded by Kazakh seismologists from their National Scientific Center for Seismological Observations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh seismologists have recorded an earthquake 253 kilometers from Almaty. The tremors were registered by the seismic stations network of the National Scientific Center for Seismological Observations and Research under the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kazakhstan on Friday, May 16, at 05:12 a.m. Astana time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They said the epicenter was 253 kilometers from Almaty, but it wasn't even felt in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They said the epicenter was two hundred fifty three kilometers from Almaty, but it wasn't even felt in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The epicenter of the earthquake was located in Kyrgyzstan, 253 kilometers southeast of Almaty," the center said in a statement. It was noted that the earthquake was not felt in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the EMSC had slightly different data—they placed it 164 kilometers from Aksu in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the E M S C had slightly different data-they placed it one hundred sixty four kilometers from Aksu in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its epicenter was located 164 kilometers from the city of Aksu (China) and 70 kilometers from the village of Kegen in the Almaty region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so there's some discrepancy in the reporting there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so there's some discrepancy in the reporting there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And it's all part of that same active seismic region, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And it's all part of that same active seismic region, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It makes you realize how much monitoring is going on across borders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It makes you realize how much monitoring is going on across borders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Multiple agencies tracking these events, even when they're not felt on the ground.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Multiple agencies tracking these events, even when they're not felt on the ground.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The tremors were registered by the seismic stations network of the National Scientific Center for Seismological Observations and Research under the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kazakhstan on Friday, May 16, at 05:12 a.m. Astana time. Meanwhile, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC), a magnitude 4.2 earthquake occurred in East Kazakhstan on May 6 at 05:12 a.m. local time, at a depth of 1 kilometer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And all this happening within just a span of about a week in mid-May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this happening within just a span of about a week in mid-May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The tremors were registered by the seismic stations network of the National Scientific Center for Seismological Observations and Research under the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kazakhstan on Friday, May 16, at 05:12 a.m. Astana time. Earlier, on the morning of May 12, a magnitude 5.0 earthquake struck Kyrgyzstan.
